basics.name: James Ward
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary:
I am an Engineer through and through - I solve practical problems. I get things done, ship amazing software, and create a superb user experience.  Unit tests, end to end testing, and test driven development are my go-to tools for crafting solid products.
This isn't just a day job to me, it's a passion.

work.summary: Automating video analysis to support better decision making. (Acquired by CesiumAstro)
highlights: Provided guidance for technical and professional growth to all members of the engineering team.
Implemented observability and automated recovery in Kubernetes to reduce mean time to recovery from hours to minutes.
Architected a runner for machine learning pipelines in Python using FastAPI, Onyx, and SQLAlchemy to replace Celery-based analysis pipelines.
Introduced unit testing, integration testing, type checking, and local environments for feature validation - allowing for more frequent deployments with a reduction in unexpected defects.
Improved the operational maturity of the engineering team to match NIST SP 800-171r3 compliance controls, achieving a DoD Authorization to Operate to fulfill USAF contracts.
Created a strong hiring structure and pipeline to build out a software engineering team.
Supported the acquisition of Vidrovr and integration of the Vidrovr platform with CesiumAstro's missions.

work.summary: Building software to enable safe, effective, and equitable healthcare operations at home. (Acquired by ICON)
highlights: Kept the engineering team's technical strategy aligned with business goals to deliver products driven by both data and user feedback - from the first lines of code of our public API to delivering lines of features that closed sales.

Led the engineering team to SOC2 and HIPAA readiness via creation of disaster recovery plans using infrastructure as code, incident preparedness playbooks, and features to support the principles of least privilege.
Developed best practices for both the Typescript backend and React frontend as well as automations to keep the team aligned to those practices.

work.summar: Organized the Platform as a Service team - developing the mission, vision, capabilities, and roadmap to encourage a high performing team with a strong sense of ownership.
highlights: Develop cross-functional initiatives migrating Venmo to a distributed architecture.
Brought reliability from 90% to 99.999% - from 73 hours to less than 30 seconds of downtime per month.
Coordinate DEI recruiting initiatives to improve representation of underrepresented groups in hiring.

work.summary: Understanding the human element behind threats to manage the risks they pose.
highlights: Built the Hivemind deception and threat intelligence platform using Node, Kafka, Tensorflow, Postgres, and ElasticSearch to support real-time personalization encouraging intruders to engage so they could be fingerprinted and tracked.

work.summary: Lead a diverse team of engineers to develop services for scalable, customizable, and personalized interactions with customers.
highlights: Architect a cross-team platform that generates over 18% of company revenue by enabling open communication with millions of active customers.
Utilized Kafka, Storm, and HBase to apply user defined rules to billions of events per day enabling marketing teams to create real-time personalized experiences for customers.

work.summary: Refactored large portions of legacy codebases to implement new features.
highlights: Create tooling for NOC automation and Denial of Service mitigation.
Wrote end-to-end and unit tests to reduce breakage during refactors and feature iteration.

work.summary: Designed and implemented new features, bug fixes, and reduced the memory footprint of the flagship product.
highlights: Optimized web stack on application servers, reducing infrastructure costs.
Integrated the product with several third-party SOAP and REST APIs.
